meanings.sent1: She kept miscreating the origami swan, folding the paper in the wrong places.
meanings.sent2: The artist realized he was miscreating the portrait when he painted the eyes too close together.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, John kept miscreating the cake, adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts at gardening were like miscreating a beautiful symphony with out-of-tune instruments.
meanings.sent5: The child's attempt at drawing a cat ended up miscreating a strange creature with four legs and a tail.

meanings.definition: The act of creating something incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: The miscreating of the sculpture was evident in its lopsided structure.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed by her miscreating of the speech, filled with errors and mispronunciations.
meanings.sent3: The miscreating of the sandwich resulted in a hilarious mess of mismatched ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His miscreating of the story turned a simple tale into a confusing jumble of events.
meanings.sent5: The miscreating of the costume made it look more like a random assortment of clothes than a superhero outfit.
